properties.title: How to use HST Spring Security Support

section.name: How to use HST Spring Security Support

subsection.name: Prerequisites
subsection.p: These instructions assume that you have a maven 3 based build for your site.

subsection.name: Add version properties to the project pom
subsection.p: In the main pom.xml of the project, in the properties section, add these properties. For the correct version numbers, check the Release Notes page.

subsection.name: Add Spring Framework Dependencies to your project
subsection.p: Check if this dependency already exists in the pom.xml of the site module. Most likely it is already there.

div.source: <!-- The HST Spring Security Support requires Spring Framework Libraries. You can declare the Spring Framework dependencies by yourself. One of the simplest way is to use hst-spring-dependencies pom dependency for convenience. --> <dependency> <groupId>org.onehippo.cms7.hst.dependencies</groupId> <artifactId>hst-spring-dependencies</artifactId> <type>pom</type> <version>${hippo.hst.version}</version> </dependency>

subsection.name: Add Spring Security Dependencies to your project
subsection.p: Add these to the pom.xml of the site module.

subsection.name: Add HST Spring Security Support Dependencies to your project
subsection.p: Add these to the pom.xml of the site module.
